intro: Laxmannia gracilis, commonly known as the slender laxmannia, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Asia. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Laxmannia gracilis thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture for shaded gardens.
